meanings.definition: The art or process of writing in shorthand.
meanings.sent1: She learned stenographies to take faster notes in class.
meanings.sent2: The court reporter's job involves using stenographies to record testimonies.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, his attempt at stenographies resulted in a hilarious mix-up of words.
meanings.sent4: Her stenographies were like a secret code, only she could decipher.
meanings.sent5: The stenographies danced across the page, capturing every spoken word.

meanings.sent1: The new employee struggled to understand the office's stenographies.
meanings.sent2: Students studying journalism often learn different stenographies for note-taking.
meanings.sent3: The stenographies of the ancient civilization were a mystery waiting to be unraveled.
meanings.sent4: In the world of stenographies, speed and accuracy are key.
meanings.sent5: The stenographies of this language are unique, making it challenging to learn.

meanings.definition: The practice or profession of transcribing spoken words into shorthand.
meanings.sent1: Her passion for stenographies led her to pursue a career as a court stenographer.
meanings.sent2: The demand for skilled stenographers is high in the legal field.
meanings.sent3: The stenographies of the news anchor were so precise that no word was missed.
meanings.sent4: In the world of stenographies, accuracy is paramount.
meanings.sent5: He admired the stenographies of the transcriptionist, marveling at their speed and precision.
